name: Tabs

jtbd.functional: Organize content into switchable views within a single context. Allow users to navigate between related content sections without leaving the page.
jtbd.affordance: Horizontal row of labeled tabs with an active indicator (underline). Users immediately recognize this as a content switcher — click a tab, see its content. The active tab is visually distinct.
jtbd.emotional: Reduces overwhelm. Instead of showing everything at once, tabs let users focus on one section at a time while knowing other sections are accessible.

anatomy.tabList: .t-tab-list — Horizontal row of tab buttons with bottom border
anatomy.tab: .t-tab — Individual tab button with underline indicator
anatomy.tabPanel: .t-tab-panel — Content area associated with a tab

state.default: Inactive tab — secondary text color, no underline.
state.active: .t-tab--active or [aria-selected='true'] — Brand color text and underline.

accessibility.ariaSelected: true on active tab, false on others
accessibility.ariaControls: Each tab points to its panel via aria-controls
accessibility.keyboard: Arrow Left/Right to navigate between tabs. Home/End for first/last. Tab key moves focus into the panel content.
accessibility.screenReader: Tab role announced with selected state. Panel content announced when tab is activated.
accessibility.focusManagement: Only the active tab is in the tab order. Arrow keys move between tabs (roving tabindex pattern).

knownIssues: Arrow key navigation requires JavaScript — CSS cannot enforce
Overflow behavior (scrollable tab list) needs testing on narrow viewports
No lazy loading of tab panel content
futureConsiderations: Vertical tabs variant for sidebar navigation
